thread.title: Boston police arrest two suspects in Boston Common stabbing case - News
thread.title_full: Boston police arrest two suspects in Boston Common stabbing case - News

author: boston.com
title: Boston police arrest two suspects in Boston Common stabbing case - News
text:
Boston police have arrested two suspects in the October 8 stabbing of a man on Boston Common.
Robert Zagarella, 31, of Boston was charged with assault with intent to murder. Meggan Durant, 28, of Roslindale, was charged with assault and battery by means of a dangerous weapon, according to police .
Related Links Man stabbed near Park Street Station Get today’s headlines right in your inbox The victim in the case was transported to Massachusetts General Hospital with serious injuries after he was stabbed multiple times near the Park Street MBTA station.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below “By compiling witness statements and physical evidence, the detectives were able to identify two suspects,” police said in a statement.
Police said members of the department’s bicycle unit were on a directed patrol searching for the suspects on Thursday when they located Zagarella and Durant near 870 Mass. Ave. around 2:30 p.m.
